Posts.Content: lisbethb wrote: My biopsy is Monday. Having an excisional because radiologist didn't think they could get a good enough view to do fine needle. It is a bummer because according to dr. the suspicious microcalcification is (his words) about the size of the tip of a sharpened pencil. I'm feeling optimistic, but do have a bit of angst. I've read some previous posts so feel like I know what to expect; they have to put me to radiology first to put the thin wires in to mark the spots where the dr. will do the surgery.Christmas is so close, I do hope I will get results before then! peace, Beth  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: readying for the excisional biopsy lisbethb cycle-path

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2011 10:33AM lisbethb wrote: Hi all -   The excisional biopsy went well and I am in very little pain! My dr. still seems positive, and during the x-ray part the tech and the PA were reassuring that the speck of microcalcificatons were so very small. I should know something by Friday. The surgery part... I don't remember at all. The insertion of the wire was not that bad. Thanks everyone. I'll post my results when I get them. cheers, beth
Posts.Title: readying for the excisional biopsy lisbethb cycle-path

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2011 08:48AM lisbethb wrote: Benign! So relieved. Got my results yesterday and the dr. says all clear. I feel very lucky, but I will keep all of you in my thoughts. This forum is an amazing resource of support, information, camraderie, and heart! It has opened my eyes, for sure. Merry Christmas, Happy Hannukah, Happy Holidays, Happy New Year! Cheers, Beth
Posts.Title: readying for the excisional biopsy lisbethb cycle-path

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2011 09:32PM lisbethb wrote: Thanks all for the support and information. Getting ready to go and take that first shower with the antiseptic wash! Too bad it doesn't look or smell like relaxing spa treatment! Another shower first thing in the a.m. then I suppose I'm ready. I'll let everyone know how it goes.Those of you also going in for procedures now, good luck!! peace, Beth
